com.view.gui.lib

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.view.gui.lib.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains 3 useful method:
    1. parseTo(String, Class) - parse input to Number in aClass Class.
    2. getError() - get error message.
    3. isError() - check is error occurred.
    Since:
    Mon 06/Mar/2017 - 11:55 PM
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    kamontat

    • Method Detail

      • getParsable

        public static Parser getParsable()
        to create this class must used this method to get parsable
        Returns:
        Parser to use Parser method

      • parseTo

        public <T extends java.lang.Number> T parseTo(java.lang.String input,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> tClass)
        Using Method parse(String, Class) with saving any error to error message so you can get error message in getError() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - expected output class.
        Parameters:
        input - String input to parse
        tClass - class that want to cast to (cannot be interface or anonymous class).
        Returns:
        number of input in Class class, or null if cannot parse to Class.

      • isError

        public boolean isError()
        check is error occurred.
        Returns:
        true if have error occurred; otherwise, false

      • getError

        public java.lang.String getError()
        given error message if have error or COMPLETE=""No Error"".
        Returns:
        error message or "No Error"

      • parse

        private <T extends java.lang.Number> T parse(@Nullable
                                             java.lang.String input,
                                             java.lang.Class<T> aClass)
                                      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                             java.lang.ClassCastException
        parse input to aClass.
        Example:
        parse("12.34", Double.class);
        parse("2", Integer.class);
        Type Parameters:
        T - expected output class.
        Parameters:
        input - input to parse.
        aClass - class that want to cast to (cannot be interface or anonymous class).
        Returns:
        number of input in Class class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if can't parse input to aClass, input is null or empty.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if can't cast input to aClass, the aClass is interface or anonymous.
